meta.name: description
meta.content: Life School is an open enrollment, tuition-free Charter School in the Dallas area with schools in Carrollton, Cedar Hill, Lancaster, Mountain Creek, Red Oak, Waxahachie.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Life Schools, life school dallas, life charter school, red oak school

h2.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.5rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

span.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.5rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

li.a: Guidance to Districts on Providing Internet to Students

div.a: Mapping COVID-19 Global Cases by Johns Hopkins CSSE
Texas Department Health and Human Services

div.style: color: #535353; font-size: 14px; font-family: 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q1 – WHAT IS THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE NOVEL (NEW) CORONAVIRUS AND COVID-19?
div.p: The Novel coronavirus is the actual virus which causes the disease named COVID-19.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.p: Most often, COVID-19 is spread from person-to-person among close contacts (about 6 feet). Person-to-person spread is thought to occur mainly via respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes, similar to how influenza and other respiratory pathogens spread. These droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.p: Most people infected with COVID-19 will show no signs at all or very mild flu-like symptoms, such as fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Only 10 to 20% of cases have been more severe, typically in people 65 years and older, and/or with underlying health conditions, such as heart disease, diabetes, or asthma. Currently, according to the CDC, the risk to the American public is low. However, this is a rapidly evolving situation, and the risk assessment may change daily. The latest updates are available on CDC’s Coronavirus Disease 2019 website.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q4 – HOW CAN I PROTECT MYSELF?

ul.li:
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds (see the CDC website for more information on handwashing).
Use an alcohol‐based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol, if soap and water are not available.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, and then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
Receive a flu vaccine if you are over the age of 6 months.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q5 – DOES WEARING A MASK PROTECT ME FROM CONTRACTING COVID-19?
div.p: There is no recommendation from the CDC right now to wear a face mask. Masks certainly do no harm, and they can help if someone who is actively sick wears them. However, when it comes to COVID-19, if you are not sick and are around someone who is sick, maintaining proper infection control such as frequent hand washing and cough etiquette is the best form of protection.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q6 – HOW IS LIFE SCHOOL PROTECTING MY CHILD?
div.p: We are closely monitoring this evolving situation in collaboration with local and federal health authorities. Our campus custodial staff will continue to disinfect campuses each day with hospital‐grade products to help offset the spread of communicable illnesses. We have trained medical personnel employed at each of our campuses who are well prepared to deliver evidence-based, high-quality medical care to our students.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q7 – WILL ONLINE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES BE AVAILABLE IN LIFE SCHOOL?
div.p: Life School is exploring our opportunities for continuity of instruction during this time.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q8 – WHAT SHOULD I DO IF I HAD CLOSE CONTACT WITH SOMEONE WHO HAS BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH COVID-19?
div.p: If you have had close contact with someone who has COVID-19, call your healthcare provider immediately and describe the contact you have had.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q9 – WHAT IF I RECENTLY TRAVELED TO AN AFFECTED AREA AND GOT SICK?

ul.li:
If you recently traveled, and within 14 days after you left, felt sick with fever, cough, or difficulty breathing, you should:
Seek medical advice – Call ahead before you go to a doctor’s office or emergency room. Tell them about your recent travel and your symptoms.
Avoid contact with others.
Not travel while sick.
Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve (not your hands) when coughing or sneezing.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q10 – IS IT SAFE TO RECEIVE PACKAGES FROM CHINA?
div.p: Yes. People receiving packages from China are not at risk of contracting COVID-19. From previous analysis, the CDC reports that coronaviruses do not survive long on objects, such as letters or packages.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q11 – CAN THE FLU OR PNEUMONIA VACCINE PROTECT ME AGAINST COVID-19?
div.p: No. Vaccines against pneumonia or the flu do not provide protection. However, vaccination against respiratory illnesses is highly recommended to protect your health. The COVID-19 virus is so new and different that it needs its own vaccine.

span.style: color: #277cb4; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif; font-size: 1.25rem; font-weight: bold

p.span: Q12 – ARE ANTIBIOTICS EFFECTIVE IN PREVENTING AND TREATING THE NEW CORONAVIRUS?

div.p: No. Antibiotics are only effective against bacteria, not viruses. Antibiotics should not be used to prevent or treat COVID-19, unless there is a bacterial co-infection.

h3.style: color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif
color: #277cb4; font-size: 1.25rem; font-family: 'Open Sans', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', sans-serif

div.h3: Q13 – WHERE CAN I GET MORE INFORMATION?

li.a: Texas Department of State Health Services
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

div.span: 132 East Ovilla Road, Suite A, Red Oak, TX 75154
